title: Planar radial mean bodies are convex
abstract:
The radial mean bodies of parameter $p>-1$ of a convex body $K \subseteq
\mathbb R^n$ are radial sets introduced in [4] by Gardner and Zhang. They are
known to be convex for $p\geq 0$. We prove that if $K \subseteq \mathbb R^2$ is
a convex body, then its radial mean body of parameter $p$ is convex for every
$p \in (-1,0)$.
